title: EAMENA
text:
Arches-powered platform

Graph databaseCIDOC-CRMBuilt-in Iso Standards and Open Science


 is a web-based, geospatial information system for Cultural Heritage management



 natively integrates the CIDOC-CRM1



DCMI (ISO 15836) 2 SKOS (ISO 25964-1) 3 SPARQL (ISO/IEC 9075-15)4 IIIF (ISO 21127) 5 EDTF (ISO 8601-2)6 WGS84 (ISO 19111)7

section: Endangered Archaeology in Middle East and North Africa
text:
Endangered Archaeology in Middle East and North Africa

WarAgricultureConstructionNatural








Destruction of the Temple of Bel (Palmyra, Syria) by ISIS on August 23, 2015


















Archaeological site (Udhma, Jordan). The area around one section of the site is completely ploughed, whilst the other half has been destroyed to plant an orchard


















Church (Ma’in, Jordan). This 2013 aerial photograph shows a road over a section of an exposed excavation of the remains of a church in (APAAME_20130414_MND-0484).


















Archaeological site (Sabratha, Libya). The site is slowly washing away into the sea














Destruction: iconoclasm, looting, etc.

title: EAMENA
text:

EAMENA is an  instance



Cultural Protection Fund (CPF) training in Amman (Jordan), December 2021








EAMENA is hosted on  (Ubuntu)









EAMENA uses  Data Base Management System.









EAMENA uses  Web Application Framework.









EAMENA uses an  distributed search









EAMENA uses an  HTTP server









EAMENA User Interface








Arches is a geospatial semantic graph platform for CH management. It natively integrates Dublin Core, CIDOC-CRM, SKOS and SPARQL. Its next version (v7) will also offer internationalisation, RTL support for the user interface and import/export of multi-language data.
